game.deck: Originally called Slasher Vol 1: Summer Camp, Friday the 13th: The Game is an asymmetrical multiplayer game. One player takes on the role of classic horror icon Jason Voorhees, while seven others play the role of camp counselors trying to survive and slay Jason.
game.description:
Overview

Friday the 13th: The Game is an asymmetrical multiplayer game featuring the slasher villain Jason Voorhees from the films of the same name. The gameplay style is 1v7 multiplayer, where one player takes on the role of Jason Voorhees as he stalks down seven camp counselors to slaughter. Meanwhile, the seven camp counselors will be tasked with trying to survive in Camp Crystal Lake, while also attempting to slay the slasher.

Originally, the game was announced as Slasher Vol 1: Summer Camp. Its original premise was that players would choose to either take on the role of six to eight teenage counselors on the site of Camp Forest Green or a stalking killer roaming through the woods. The objective as the counselors was to survive the night, while the killer's objective is to commit bloody murder against the counselors. The focus of the game was on multiplayer, and the "map" for Camp Forest Green is set up in an arena style.

Slasher Vol 1: Summer Camp was announced in October 2014. Kane Hodder, the original actor of Jason Voorhees, was announced as being involved with the project in February 2015. The rebranding of Slasher Vol 1 to Friday the 13th: The game was announced in October 2015.

The game will utilize Unreal Engine 4 for its development.

Development

"Countdown"

On September 19th, the official Summer Camp website was updated with a countdown timer, and an announcement was also made on the official Facebook page. The image on the page features a VCR with a countdown timer (originally starting at 24 days), as well as a VHS cassette being loaded into the VCR that read "Summer Camp" on the label.

Rebranding and Kickstarter Launch

On October 12th, 2015, Gun Media announced that they would be rebranding Slasher Vol 1: Summer Camp to become Friday the 13th: The Game, an officially-licensed adaptation of the film franchise starring Jason Voorhees. The game would still retain its asymmetrical multiplayer mode, where one player takes on the role of Voorhees and seven others take on the roles of teenage campers being chased down by him.

Alongside the announcement, a Kickstarter funding campaign was launched, looking to raise $700,000 to make the game. Stretch goals include a single player campaign and the return of Tommy Jarvis (the main protagonist from three of the Friday the 13th movies).

Kane Hodder, the actor best known for portraying Jason Voorhees, will be returning to perform motion capture for the character in the game. Alongside him, Sean S. Cunningham (director of the first Friday the 13th) will serve as a consultant on the game, and horror legend Tom Savini will serve as executive producer as well as designing the kills that Jason will perform in the game.
game.name: Friday the 13th: The Game

game.deck: Overwatch is a stylish, hero-based first-person multiplayer shooter created by Blizzard. A beta is set to launch in Fall 2015.

Development History

Overwatch rises from the ashes of Titan, Blizzard's canceled MMO-project. Overwatch was the name of Titan's PVP component, featuring some of the same basic characters now found in Overwatch, albeit with different names. Overwatch uses the engine initially developed for Titan.

game.deck: 2D action platform game with an 80s anime inspired look and competitive local multiplayer.
game.description:
Overview

Capsule Force uses a one-on-one or two-on-two competitive setup to pitch players against each other in a race to one side of the current level. The objective for each team is to reach the right-most or left-most screen of the stage (depending on which team they are on) and to collect the Capsule there to win. Each one of the eight stages in the game is made up of a number of separate screens with special platforms on them. When a character from the red team stands on a platform it will begin moving towards one side of the screen, while if a character from the blue team stands on it it will move towards the other. Should the platform hit the edge of the screen the focus of the level will move one screen over and this pattern will continue until the platform reaches the end of its track and the Capsule is accessible. Players may use their projectile weaponry to help them gain control of the platforms from the other team or keep them away from the Capsule, and in various areas must also dodge environmental hazards.

Capsule Force places an emphasis on chaotic visuals, with bright flashes and laser beams being a near constant element of play. In addition to the local multiplayer mode the game also includes 30 single-player challenge rooms.
game.name: Capsule Force

game.deck: A compilation containing Fibbage XL, Drawful, Word Spud, Lie Swatter and You Don't Know Jack (2015).
game.description:
Overview

The Jackbox Party Pack is a compilation pack from Jackbox Games for the PC, MAC, Xbox One, Android TV, OUYA, Amazon Fire TV, PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 containing Fibbage XL, Drawful, Word Spud, Lie Swatter and You Don't Know Jack (2015). The console version released on November 18, 2014, with Steam counterparts releasing shorty after on November 26, 2014 (PC) and January 9, 2015 (MAC).

Gameplay

With the Jackbox Party Pack controllers are no more, any capable smartphone can be used as a controller making it easy for anyone and everyone to get in on the action.

  • You Don't Know Jack 2015 - The comedy trivia game from Jackbox make a appearances with hundreds of all-new questions. (1-4 Players)
  • Drawful - Draw what you are given, have friends and family figure it out. (3-8 Players)
  • Fibbage XL - A hilarious bluffing game, contains 50% more questions than the original release. (2-8 Players)
  • Lie Swatter - Get facts, make up questions in Lie Swatters. (1-100 Players)
  • Word Spud - A fill in the blank word game. (2-8 Players)

System Requirements

PC

  • OS: XP / Vista / 7 / 8
  • Processor: 2 Ghz Dual Core or higher
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Hard Drive: 650 MB available space

Mac

  • OS: Mac OSX 10.5+
  • Processor: Dual Core or higher
  • Memory: 200 MB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Hard Drive: 650 MB available space

Useful Links

  • Official Website
  • Steam Link
  • Xbox One Store Link
  • PSN Store (PS3)
  • PSN Store (PS4)
  • OUYA Link
  • Android/Fire TV Link
game.name: The Jackbox Party Pack
